sentences.sContent: Usually Gus would bring his harmonica and, after talking for a little while, they’d play a few songs together.
sentences.sContent_eng: Usually Gus would bring his harmonica and, after talking for a little while, they’d play a few songs together.
sentences.sCn: 通常盖斯会带着他的口琴，在聊了一会儿以后，他们会一起演奏几首歌。

sentences.sContent: In 1995, when the ban went into effect, the only instrument allowed in the Cumberland prison was the harmonica, but inmates who already had a guitar or electronic keyboard were allowed to keep them.
sentences.sContent_eng: In 1995, when the ban went into effect, the only instrument allowed in the Cumberland prison was the harmonica, but inmates who already had a guitar or electronic keyboard were allowed to keep them.
sentences.sCn: 1995年该禁令实行后，坎伯兰监狱的囚犯们被允许拥有的乐器就只剩下口琴了，但在此之前已经有电吉他或键盘的囚犯被批准可以保留这些乐器。

sentences.sContent: He made a harmonica out of the corncob.
sentences.sContent_eng: He made a harmonica out of the corncob.
sentences.sCn: 他把玉米棒子弄得象口琴一样。

trans.tranOther: a small musical instrument that you play by blowing or sucking and moving it from side to side near your mouth
